title: ICE: ` cannot relate bound region: '_#56r <= ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(1), BoundRegion { ... }`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code ```Rust #![crate_type="lib"] impl Validator for All where for<'iter> Validator<<&'iter I>::Item>: , I: 'static, {} pub trait Validator {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (28a29282f 2023-04-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: 28a29282f6dde2e4aba6e1e4cfea5c9430a00217 commit-date: 2023-04-06 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.2 ``` ### Error output ``` error[E0412]: cannot find type `All` in this scope --> treereduce.out:2:29 | 2 | impl Validator for All | ^^^ not found in this scope warning: trait objects without an explicit `dyn` are deprecated --> treereduce.out:4:16 | 4 | for<'iter> Validator<<&'iter I>::Item>: , | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = warning: this is accepted in the current edition (Rust 2015) but is a hard error in Rust 2021! = note: for more information, see = note: `#[warn(bare_trait_objects)]` on by default help: use `dyn` | 4 | for<'iter> dyn Validator<<&'iter I>::Item>: , | +++ ```
Backtrace
